On Apr 17, 2007, at 3:02 AM, shanemcdonaldryan wrote:

> Plus I can't see why multiplying using a ternary
> operator will be faster than multiplying using *= -1

In the hardware, flipping a sign is always going to be faster than a  
multiply; however, you only do it once.. so any gains from this are  
close to negligible.

I wouldn't be surprised if your compiler can transform x *= -1 to x =  
-x.  To verify this, you should look at the assembler.

In fact I just verified that my compiler (686-apple-darwin8- 
gcc-4.0.1), even without the optimizer enabled, will do this without  
using a multiplication.

--Steve
--Apple-Mail-18-948629084
